item.title: Data Interpolation 数据插值
item.description: 1. Introduction Supposed we need one property data to study on problem, and we measure that property in the field, recorded as p(x), where x is the coordinates of that property, which can be spatial coordinates or temporal coordinates. In the realy world, we can’t make sure that those p are regularlly measured. However, many data analysis methods needs the data to be regularly recorded, or

item.title: Build-in Shortcodes
item.description: See https://gohugo.io/content-management/shortcodes/#use-hugos-built-in-shortcodes figure 2 People Sitting With View of Yellow Flowers during Daytime gist highlight <section id="main"> <div> <h1 id="title">{{ .Title }}</h1> {{ range .Data.Pages }} {{ .Render "summary"}} {{ end }} </div> </section> instagram View this post on Instagram #Talitha #Getty #yacht in #fjærland #fjærlandsfjorden #sognefjorden #mundal #norway #landscape #panorama #travel #instagoodmyphoto #justgoshoot #peoplescreatives #visualsoflife #photography #photoshoot #photodaily #photogram #instagood #picoftheday #fjærland #photooftheday #pentax #nrksf #sognavis

item.title: Table of Contents
item.description: Note The TableOfContents field with true in your content’s front matter will render a table of contents. TableOfContents: true Setting the built-in .TableOfContents variables can configure what heading levels you want to include in TOC. item.title: About Me
item.description: Zelun Wu Ph.D. student of Physical Oceanography, Xiamen University & University of Delaware zelunwu@stu.xmu.edu.cn, zelunwu@udel.edu Research Interests Climate Change, Marine Heatwaves Educations Xiamen University, Bachelor of Science (2012 – 2016) Xiamen University, Master of Physical Oceanography (2016 – 2018) Dual Degree, Ph.D. student of Physical Oceanography, Xiamen University, University of Delaware (2019 – ) Publications Jiamei Huang, Wei Zhuang, Xiao-Hai Yan, Zelun Wu, 2020, Impacts of the upper-ocean salinity variations on the decadal sea level change in the southeast Indian Ocean during the Argo era, https://doi.
